Award.AwardTitle: Stochastic processes and high dimensional probability distributions, Russia, Summer 2014
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides support of the US participation in the conference
"Stochastic processes and high dimensional probability distributions"
which will be held at the Euler Mathematical Institute, Saint Petersburg,
on June 16-20, 2014. The main theme of the conference is the insights
into stochastic processes which arise in the light of high dimensional
phenomena. It will focus on several closely related directions including:
Geometric problems about Gaussian and linear stochastic processes;
Typical distributions, concentration and other high dimensional phenomena;
Optimal transportation, associated Sobolev-type and information-theoretic
inequalities.

The mission of this forum is to consolidate and further encourage
investigations in the above mentioned directions. There will be talks by
internationally known speakers on a wide variety of topics. The organizers
expect about 12-15 participants from USA, out of the total number of 40-50
scientists representing different schools. It provides an opportunity to
review the latest results in the field and to meet several generations of
researchers including postdoc and graduate students. Broadening participation
of women and junior scientists from under-represented groups is anticipated.
The results of the meeting will be disseminated and contribute to the
enhancement and improvement of scientific and educational activities.

Website of the conference: http://www.pdmi.ras.ru/EIMI/2014/Sppd/index.html

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project was for support of the US participation, with priority given to graduate students and junior researchers, in the conference "Stochastic processes and high dimensional probability distributions", held at the Euler Mathematical Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Saint Petersburg, Russia, on June 16-20, 2014.

The main theme of the conference was the insights into stochastic processes which arise in the light of high dimensional phenomena. Such phenomena arise in crucial ways in Probability Theory and Analysis in a variety of asymptotic problems. The conference focused on several closely related directions in Probability Theory and Analysis including: Geometric problems about Gaussian and linear stochastic processes; Typical distributions, concentration and other high dimensional phenomena; Optimal transportation, associated Sobolev-type and information-theoretic inequalities. Topics of the conference represent mainstreams in modern Mathematics, with an unbounded range of applications in Probability, Convex Geometry, Asymptotic Geometric Analysis, as well as in applied-oriented disciplines (Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning among others).

The conference provided a welcome opportunity to review the latest results in the field and encouraged interaction among several generations of researchers, representing different scientific schools from the USA, Canada, Europe, and Russia. The conference contributed in training and professional development of junior researchers, postdocs, graduate students, with broad participation of under-represented groups.

The conference was also sponsored by the Chebyshev Laboratory (Saint Petersburg University), Dynasty Foundation, and Russian Foundation for Basic Research.
